Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection it was discovered that all personnel file reviewed were missing Form 2912, The pre-employment affidavit
Correction Narrative: The facility responded: During the Pre-Employment process, all future applicants will be required to complete the 2912 Form. This form has been attached to the Kismet RTC Employment Application. Also, the 2912 Form has been implemented in the pre-employment standardized checklist, for all required documents prior to hiring and onboarding. The Director of Human Resources will ensure that all pre-employment documents (including the 2912 Form) are collected and verified prior to hire.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection it was discovered that 2 of the serious incidents reviewed were missing the informed care strategy to avoid future occurences.
Correction Narrative: The facility responded: The trauma informed care strategies designed to prevent future unauthorized absences, and the operational support for these strategies have been incorporated into the Unauthorized Absence Debriefing Form. Additionally, all staff members have been notified and oriented on the appropriate debriefing procedures to follow when a child returns from an unauthorized absence.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection while receiving child records 1 out of 4 active child records reviewed was not signed.
Correction Narrative: All admission documents (including the Childs Rights) will be reviewed prior to being scanned in shared drive. Also, the documents will be reviewed to ensure all signatures and information captured at the time of admission, is properly documented in each childs record.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection reviewing child records 1 out of the 4 active records reviewed did not contain the child's preferred de-escalation techniques that caregivers can use to assist the child in the process.
Correction Narrative: The operation responded all admission documents (including the EBI Policies and procedures) will be reviewed prior to being scanned in shared drive. Also, the documents will be reviewed to ensure all signatures and information captured at the time of admission, is properly documented in each childs record.

Deficiency Narrative: Two out of four active youth files reviewed contained inaccurate names and non-personalized information in the preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative: Each childs service plan, preliminary service plan, etc. will be reviewed after completion by the Executive Director to ensure errorless documentation. Monthly audits will be conducted by the Executive Director to ensure all documentation (i.e. service plans, preliminary service plans, and all other reports) are accurately completed.

Deficiency Narrative: The child's service plan advises that she would be monitored in close proximity due to her behaviors, however the child was allowed to be outside alone, while staff watched her from inside of the facility.
Correction Narrative: Interviews conducted with children in care confirmed that staff does not leave them unsupervised and uses verbally redirection as an effort to prevent unauthorized absences.

Deficiency Narrative: Two residence were able to jump the gate and elope from the operation due to lack of proper supervision.
Correction Narrative: Interviews conducted with children in care confirmed that staff does not leave them unsupervised and uses verbally redirection as an effort to prevent unauthorized absences.

Deficiency Narrative: Three staff did not have any unrelated reference checks in their file.
Correction Narrative:
The operation stated:
Prior to the initiation of hire, the Director of Human Resources will complete the pre-employment process. This process will include at least 2-3 unrelated reference checks to determine if the applicant is suitable to work around children. The current reference check form has been revised to reflect the required information. Also, the current employment application has been revised to include unrelated references for each applicant to complete.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that only one previous employer was contacted for three current staff.
Correction Narrative:
The operation stated:
Prior to the initiation of hire, the Director of Human Resources will complete the pre-employment process. This process will include the verification of at least (3) employer reference checks. The employer reference checks will be documented and filed in each employees file once hired. The current reference check form and employment application has been updated to include this information.

Deficiency Narrative: The facility was contacted & unresponsive for over an hour during an emergent situation involving a child in care.
Correction Narrative:
The operation stated:
Kismet Residential Treatment Center has re-developed and implemented a well-organized, and comprehensive plan for the availability of emergency contacts. (1.) A list of primary emergency contacts has been developed, as it pertains to each child in the care of Kismet Residential Treatment Center. This list has been provided to each childs legal team (i.e., caseworker, CASA, AAL, etc.) and uploaded to each childs Tomball ISD School Portal. (2.) The list has been established based on a hierarchy of contacts that are prioritized according to the emergency contacts availability, and proximity to the facility. This is to assist in determining the order in which each individual listed should be contacted, during different emergent situations. Also, to ensure that any/all emergent situations are addressed in a timely manner. 
(3.) Secondary Contacts have been identified and listed if a primary contact is unavailable. (4.) All staff members have been informed of the communication protocol, as it applies to contacting individuals in emergent situations. All KRTC staff members have been made aware that all phone calls made to the facility, must be answered and/or routed to the appropriate individuals or departments. Any missed calls must be returned as soon as possible. (5.) KRTC will regularly review and update any emergency contacts to reflect changes in contact information. The childs school and legal team will be notified of any changes in writing.

Deficiency Narrative: 4 of 4 admissions assessments did not include any recommendations for further testing or assessments.
Correction Narrative:
Kismet stated:
All completed Admission Assessments will include any identified further testing or assessments. If there are no recommendations for further testing or assessments, this information will be documented in the Admission Assessment to ensure that this information is captured and documented appropriately.

Deficiency Narrative: Records were not in the files after 30 days of occurrence. The Inspector arrived at the facility at 1030am, completed file records were not provided to the Inspector until 3pm.
Correction Narrative:
Kismet stated:
748.399(a) Records Available for Licensing-all active records immediately available for review and reproduction. (Weight: Medium)

	Records were not in the files after 30 days of occurrence. The inspector arrived at the facility at 1030am, completed file records were not provided to the inspector until 3pm. 	10/9/2023	All records will be made available for licensing immediately upon request. Also, Kismet will ensure that all records are electronically available for immediate production. This is to streamline the approach to document management and efficiency. This will allow access to the information needed quickly and reliably, improving overall productivity that ensures documentation is available in each childs eRecord prior to the 30-day occurrence. All access to eFiles and eRecords will be made available to licensing upon request. Kimset Residential will adopt best practices to also ensure that all records are assembled prior to the childs 30 days of placement at the operation. Also, all documents will be filed within 14 days of occurrence in each child manual file.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of five child files are missing signed child's rights.
Correction Narrative: Kismet stated: The child's rights form was unavailable because the file was locked in the office. Moving forward, Permit Holder Angie Bacon now has "a copy of her office key now just in case she forget to put the files in the file room.  All documents are also scanned and saved in our Google drive for immediate access."

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of five children's files were unavailable at the time of inspection. They were on site, but in a locked room in which present staff did not have a key.
Correction Narrative: Kismet stated: Permit Holder Angie Bacon now has "a copy of her office key now just in case she forget to put the files in the file room.  All documents are also scanned and saved in our Google drive for immediate access."

Deficiency Narrative: Medications are located in a locked closet. However, the black file cabinet containing Schedule II medications was unlocked with the key inside the lock.

A walk through of the facility revealed that there is an unpleasant odor emanating from the toilet and bathrooms in the girl's quarters. There is a need to regularly the grass in the backyard. A leaning pole at the backyard, behind the admin building, needs to be fixed.
Correction Narrative: Work orders were sent to address the issues pertaining to physical site.

Deficiency Narrative: No fire extinguisher was placed in the hallway area where a fire extinguisher should have been placed. The fire extinguisher was eventually placed in the designated area and was inspected to be in good working condition.
1 of 1 medication logs had two medications, Aripiprazole and Hydroxyzine, with medication log counts and actual pill counts that didnt match.
Correction Narrative:
The Administrator will ensure that all medication passers will receive an in depth 2-hour medication refresher training on Thursday, April 20th.  The 2-hour training will be instructor led by Nidhin Joseph, Pharmacist and Larrina Rogers, ED.  The Administrator will file all certificates in the staff records and provide copies to CCR staff Ms. Barriere.
As part of the CAP starting 4/20/23; the ED or designee will review the medications and logs daily for accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: A medication error that occurred on 4/6/23 was not documented until 4/13/23.
Correction Narrative:
A medication error form was placed in the file at the time of inspection visit.  All medication passers will receive an in depth 2-hour medication refresher training on Thursday, April 20th.  The 2-hour training will be instructor led by Nidhin Joseph, Pharmacist and Larrina Rogers, ED.  
The Administrator will file all certificates in the staff records and provide copies to CCR staff Ms. Barriere.

As part of the CAP starting 4/20/23; the ED or designee will review the medications and logs daily for accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: The incident that warranted medical treatment for the children on 3/31/23 was not reported to licensing until 4/2/23
Correction Narrative:
Kismet stated:
Residential and Administrative staff have been made aware of that the EMS is considered a Medical Professional and if treatment is provided by this entity, it must be reported within 24hrs.  This will also be reiterated in our all staff meeting on Wednesday June 28th.

Deficiency Narrative: The current Administrator was employed at another-non-contiguous operation.
Correction Narrative:
Administrative Review is being requested for this citation.

Administrator is not employed as an Administrator at any other residential childcare operation. Administrator will only be the LCAA for the current operation unless another Administrator assumes that role in the further. If this does occur the Inspector will be notified within the appropriate timeframe according to the Minimum Standards.

Deficiency Narrative: Bedroom windows did not have a covering for privacy.
Correction Narrative:
On 10/27/2022 a physical follow-up was conducted and compliance is met.

The Administrator met with the Contractor who stated he will have all the coverings on the windows by 10/15/22 for the childrens privacy. A in person follow will be conducted to ensure compliance has been met.

Deficiency Narrative: Debriefing form not available for review.
Correction Narrative:
Kismet stated:
The debriefing form has been placed in the unauthorized absences binder and the mock child file. Please see attached form.
